lifecycle_phases.description: Preparation of seedlings in a controlled environment before transplanting to the main field.
procedures: Select healthy, certified seeds (approx. 20-25 kg/acre).
Seed Treatment: Soak seeds in Carbendazim (2g/kg) for 24 hours to prevent seed-borne diseases.
Prepare raised beds of 1-1.5m width and convenient length.
Sow seeds uniformly and cover with a thin layer of soil/manure.
Irrigate gently to maintain saturation but avoid flooding initially.
Apply Nitrogen (Urea) in small doses if seedlings show yellowing.
preventive_tips: Avoid high Nitrogen application in nursery to prevent Blast.
Maintain proper water level (2-3 cm) after seedling establishment.
PREVENTION: Seed treatment is the most critical step here.

lifecycle_phases.description: Moving seedlings from nursery to the main puddled field.
procedures: Plough the main field 2-3 times to achieve a soft puddled consistency.
Level the field perfectly to ensure uniform water standing.
Apply basal fertilizer dose (DAP/Complex) before final levelling.
Transplant 21-25 day old seedlings.
Plant 2-3 seedlings per hill at a spacing of 20x10 cm or 20x15 cm.
Maintain 2-3 cm water level during transplanting.
preventive_tips: Dip seedling roots in Chloropyriphos solution if stem borer is endemic.
Ensure field is leveled to prevent water stagnation in pockets (avoids snail damage).
Proper spacing ensures good aeration and reduces fungal risks.

lifecycle_phases.description: Active growth phase where the plant produces tillers (branches). Critical for yield.
procedures: Maintain water level at 5cm.
Weeding: Apply herbicide or manual weeding at 20 and 40 days after transplanting.
Top Dressing: Apply 1st dose of Urea (Nitrogen) 30 days after transplanting.
Monitor for Stem Borer (Dead hearts) and Leaf Folder.
Scout for Blast spots on leaves.
preventive_tips: Avoid excess Nitrogen fertilizer which promotes Blast and BLB.
Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) saves water and reduces pest incidence.
Keep bunds clean to remove host weeds.

lifecycle_phases.description: Plant stops producing tillers and starts producing grain panicles.
procedures: Apply 2nd dose of Urea and Potash (MOP) at Panicle Initiation stage.
Maintain steady water level (5cm). Do not allow field to dry.
Protect from Gundhi Bug during milky stage.
Fungicide spray (preventive) may be needed if weather is cloudy/humid.
preventive_tips: Spray Propiconazole (1ml/L) at booting stage to prevent False Smut.

lifecycle_phases.description: Grains fill, harden, and change color from green to gold.
procedures: Drain water from the field 10-15 days before expected harvest.
Harvest when 80-85% grains are golden yellow.
Thresh immediately after harvest.
Dry grains to 12-14% moisture content for storage.
preventive_tips: Harvest at physiological maturity to prevent grain shattering and cracking.
Protect harvested crop from erratic rains.

rice_blast.name: Rice Blast (Pyricularia oryzae)
symptoms: Diamond/spindle-shaped lesions with gray centers and brown margins on leaves.
Rotting of neck (Neck Blast) causing panicle to fall over.
rice_blast.favorable_conditions: High humidity (>90%), cloudy weather, low night temperatures, high Nitrogen use.
preventive_measures: Treat seeds with Tricyclazole before sowing.

bacterial_leaf_blight.name: Bacterial Leaf Blight (Xanthomonas oryzae)
symptoms: Water-soaked streaks on leaf edges starting from tip.
Leaves turn yellow/straw-colored and dry up.
Milky ooze (bacterial bead) seen on leaves in early morning.
bacterial_leaf_blight.favorable_conditions: Strong winds, heavy rain, high temperature (25-34°C).
preventive_measures: Avoid clipping seedling tips before transplanting.

chemical: Spray Streptocycline (0.1g) + Copper Oxychloride (3g) per liter of water.

brown_spot.name: Brown Spot
symptoms: Oval/circular brown spots with localized yellow halo.
brown_spot.favorable_conditions: Potassium deficiency, poor soil fertility, water stress.

false_smut.name: False Smut
symptoms: Individual grains transform into large velvety orange/green balls.
Only few grains in a panicle are affected.
false_smut.favorable_conditions: High humidity, rainfall during flowering, high Nitrogen.
preventive_measures: Correct sowing time to avoid flowering during rain.

chemical: Spray Copper Hydroxide or Propiconazole at 50% Panicle emergence.

sheath_blight.name: Sheath Blight
symptoms: Oval or irregular greenish-grey spots on leaf sheath near water line.
Spots enlarge and coalesce, causing entire leaves to die.
sheath_blight.favorable_conditions: Close planting, high humidity, high Nitrogen.
